fields.name: Room
fields.desc: This component specifies the code for the patient room. After point of care, it is the most general person location designation. Refer to User-defined Table 0303 - Room for suggested values.

fields.name: Bed
fields.desc: This component specifies the code for the patient bed. After room, it is the most general person location designation. Refer to User-defined Table 0304 - Bed for suggested values.

fields.name: Facility
fields.desc: This component is subject to site interpretation but generally describes the highest level physical designation of an institution, medical center or enterprise. It is the most general person location designation.

fields.name: Location Status
fields.desc: This component specifies the code for the status or availability of the location. For example, it may convey bed status. Refer to User-defined Table 0306 - Location status for suggested values.

fields.name: Patient Location Type
fields.desc: Person location type is the categorization of the persons location defined by facility, building, floor, point of care, room or bed. Although not a required field, when used, it may be the only populated field. It usually includes values such as nursing unit, department, clinic, SNF, physicians office. Refer to User-defined Table 0305 - Person location type for suggested values.

fields.name: Building
fields.desc: This component specifies the code for the building where the person is located. After facility, it is the most general person location designation. Refer to User-defined Table 0307 - Building for suggested values.

fields.name: Floor
fields.desc: This component specifies the code for the floor where the person is located. After building, it is the most general person location designation. Refer to User-defined Table 0308 - Floor for suggested values.

fields.name: Address
fields.desc: This component describes the location in free text.

datatypes.desc: The entity identifier defines a given entity within a specified series of identifiers.

fields.name: Entity Identifier
fields.desc: The first component, <entity identifier>, is usually defined to be unique within the series of identifiers created by the <assigning authority>, defined by a hierarchic designator, represented by components 2 through 4. See Section 2.A.33, "HD - hierarchic designator".

fields.name: Namespace Id
fields.desc: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.

datatypes.desc: This data type specifies the type and number of days for which a certification is valid.

fields.name: Day Type
fields.desc: Specifies whether the days are denied, pending, or approved.

fields.name: Number Of Days
fields.desc: Specifies the number of days for which the certification is valid.

datatypes.desc: Note: DR cannot be legally expressed when embedded within another data type. Its use is constrained to a segment field.

fields.name: Range Start Date/Time
fields.desc: The first component contains the earliest date/time (time stamp) in the specified range.

fields.name: Range End Date/Time
fields.desc: The second component contains the latest date/time in the specified range. Note that the TS (time stamp) data type allows the specification of precision.

datatypes.desc:
This data type is used for specifying an identifier with its associated administrative detail.

Example: |1234567^4^M11^ADT01^MR^Good Health Hospital|

fields.name: Id Number
fields.desc: The value of the identifier itself.

fields.name: Check Digit
fields.desc: The check digit in this data type is not an add-on produced by the message processor. It is the check digit that is part of the identifying number used in the sending application. If the sending application does not include a self-generated check digit in the identifying number, this component should be valued null.

fields.name: Check Digit Scheme
fields.desc: Contains the code identifying the check digit scheme employed.

fields.name: Assigning Authority
fields.desc: The assigning authority is a unique name of the system (or organization or agency or department) that creates the data. . Refer to User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority for suggested values.

fields.name: Identifier Type Code
fields.desc: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the Assigning authority component. Refer to HL7 Table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Facility
fields.desc: The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the patient. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier: as part of this data type, its existence is a convenience for certain intercommunicating systems.

fields.name: Effective Date
fields.desc: The first date, if known, on which the identifier is valid and active.

fields.name: Expiration Date
fields.desc: The last date, if known, on which the identifier is valid and active.

fields.name: Assigning Jurisdiction
fields.desc: The geo-political body that assigned the identifier in component 1.

fields.name: Assigning Agency Or Department
fields.desc: The agency or department that assigned the identifier in component 1.

datatypes.desc: Describes a reference range and its supporting detail.

fields.name: Numeric Range
fields.desc: This component specifies the numeric interval of the reference data. Range is taken to be inclusive (i.e., the range includes the end points). Units are context sensitive and are defined in the usage note for the field where this data type is used.

fields.name: Administrative Sex
fields.desc: This component specifies which gender for which the reference range is valid. Refer to User-defined Table 0001 - Administrative Sex for suggested values.

fields.name: Age Range
fields.desc: This component specifies the age range for which the reference range is valid. Ages of less than one year should be specified as a fraction (e.g., 1 month = 0.0830, 1 week = 0.01920, 1 day = 0.0027300). However, for most purposes involving infants, the gestational age (measured in weeks) is preferred. The lower end of the range is not indicated; the upper end is, assuring that series of ranges do not overlap.

fields.name: Gestational Age Range
fields.desc: This component specifies the gestational age range for which the reference range is valid. Gestational age is relevant only when the reference range is influenced by the stage of pregnancy. The gestational age is measured in weeks from conception. For example, |1&4| implies that the normals apply to gestational ages from 1 week to 4 weeks inclusive. The lower end of the range is not included; the upper end is, assuring that series of age ranges do not overlap.

fields.name: Species
fields.desc: This component specifies the species for which the reference range is valid. Species is assumed to be human unless otherwise stated. Example values are rabbit, mouse, and rat.

fields.name: Race/Subspecies
fields.desc: This component specifies the race or subspecies for which the reference range is valid. In the case of humans (the default species), the race is specified when race influences the reference range. When normal ranges for animals are being described, this component can be used to describe subspecies or special breeds of animals.

fields.name: Conditions
fields.desc: This component specifies any arbitrary condition for which the reference range is valid. This may include such conditions as phase of menstrual cycle or dose of a particular drug. It is provided as a way to communicate the normal ranges for special conditions. It does not allow automatic checking of these text conditions.

datatypes.desc:
This data type transmits codes and the formatted text associated with the code. This data type can be used to transmit for the first time the formatted text for the canned text portion of a report, for example, a standard radiological description for a normal chest X-ray. The receiving system can store this information and in subsequent messages only the identifier need be sent. Another potential use of this data type is transmitting master file records that contain formatted text.

Example:  OBX||CF|71020^CXR^99CPMC||79989^\H\Description:\N\\.sp\\ti+4\Heart is not enlarged. There is no evidence of pneumonia, effusion, pneumothorax or any masses. \.sp+3\\H\Impression:\N\\.sp\\.ti+4\Negative chest.^99CPMC

fields.name: Identifier
fields.desc: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Formatted Text
fields.desc: Name or description of the item in question with the addition of embedded formatting instructions.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.desc: Contains the name of the coding system employed.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.desc: Alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the <text>. This identifier is the equivalent of component one.

fields.name: Alternate Formatted Text
fields.desc: Name or description of the alternate identifier in question with the addition of embedded formatting instructions.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.desc: Contains the name of the coding system employed for the alternate identifier.

datatypes.desc: Specifies a coded element and its associated detail. The CWE data type is used when 1) more than one table may be applicable or 2) the specified HL7 or externally defined table may be extended with local values or 3) when text is in place, the code may be omitted.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.desc: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.desc: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.desc: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Analogous to "Identifier" in component 1. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.desc: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.desc: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System above. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.desc: This is the version ID for the coding system identified by components 1-3. It belongs conceptually to the group of component 1-3 and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.desc: This is the version ID for the coding system identified by components 4-6. It belongs conceptually to the group of alternate components (See usage note in section introduction) and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.desc: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

datatypes.desc: Specifies the healthcare facility to which the patient was discharged and the date.

fields.name: Discharge Location
fields.desc: Specifies the healthcare facility to which the patient was discharged. Refer to User-defined Table 0113 - Discharged to location for suggested values.

fields.name: Effective Date
fields.desc: Specifies the date on which the patient was discharged to a healthcare facility.

datatypes.desc:
This data type contains a segment field name and the list of values to be passed to the query processor.

Example: |@PID.5.1^EVANS|

fields.name: Segment Field Name
fields.desc: This component contains the segment field name.

fields.name: Values
fields.desc: This component contains the field value or values in the form "value1& value2 & value3"

datatypes.desc:
Note: CQ cannot be legally expressed when embedded within another data type. Its use is constrained to a segment field. 

Examples: 
|123.7^kg|  kilograms is an ISO unit 
|150^lb&&ANSI+| weight in pounds is a customary US unit defined within ANSI+.

fields.name: Quantity
fields.desc: This component specifies the numeric quantity or amount of an entity.

fields.name: Units
fields.desc: This component species the units in which the quantity is expressed. Field-by-field, default units may be defined within the specifications. When the quantity is measured in the default units, the units need not be transmitted. If the quantity is recorded in units different from the default, the units must be transmitted.

fields.name: Version Id
fields.desc: Used to identify the HL7 version. Refer to HL7 Table 0104 - Version ID in section 2.15.9.12 for valid values.

fields.name: Internationalization Code
fields.desc: Used to identify the international affiliate country code. The values to be used are those of ISO 3166 -1:1977. The ISO 3166 table has three separate forms of the country code: HL7 specifies that the 3-character (alphabetic) form be used for the country code.

fields.name: International Version Id
fields.desc: This field component identifies international affiliates version; it is especially important when the international affiliate has more than a single local version associated with a single US version.

datatypes.desc: This data type specifies the practitioners specialty and related information.

fields.name: Specialty Name
fields.desc: Identifies the providers specialty.

fields.name: Governing Board
fields.desc: Identifies the governing body providing for the specialty.

fields.name: Eligible Or Certified
fields.desc: Specifies the certification status. Refer to HL7 Table 0337 - Certification status for valid values.

fields.name: Date Of Certification
fields.desc: Specifies when certification occurred.

datatypes.desc: Specifies whether a charge action is based on an invocation event or is time-based.

fields.name: Invocation Event
fields.desc: Specifies the code for the event precipitating/triggering the charge activity. Refer to HL7 Table 0100 - Invocation event for valid values.

fields.name: Date/Time
fields.desc: The second component is used to express the exact time to charge for the ordered service; it is used only when the CCD.1 value is T. When used, it is expressed as a TS data type.

datatypes.desc: Specifies the segment that contains an error and describes the nature of the error.

fields.name: Segment Id
fields.desc: The segment containing the error in another message

fields.name: Segment Sequence
fields.desc: Specifies the specific occurrence if the segment specified in component 1 occurs more than once in the message.

fields.name: Field Position
fields.desc: Ordinal position of the data field within the segment. For systems that do not use the HL7 Encoding Rules, the data item number may be used for the third component.

fields.name: Code Identifying Error
fields.desc: A code that describes the nature of the error. Refer to HL7 Table 0357 - Message error condition codes for valid values.

datatypes.desc: Specifies the date and institution information where a staff member became active or inactive.

fields.name: Date
fields.desc: Specifies the date when a staff member became active or inactive.

fields.name: Institution Name
fields.desc: Specifies the institution where a staff member is or was active. Refer to User-Defined Table0531 - Institutions for suggested values.

datatypes.desc: This data type allows full specification of the surname of a person. Where appropriate, it differentiates the person's own surname from that of the person's partner or spouse, in cases where the person's name may contain elements from either name. It also permits messages to distinguish the surname prefix (such as "van" or "de") from the surname root.

fields.name: Surname
fields.desc: The atomic element of the person's family name. In most Western usage, this is the person's last name.

fields.name: Own Surname Prefix
fields.desc: Internationalization usage for Germanic languages. This component is optional. An example of a <surname prefix> is the "van" in "Ludwig van Beethoven". Since the <surname prefix> doesn't sort completely alphabetically, it is reasonable to specify it as a separate sub-component of the PN and extended PN data types (XPN and XCN).

fields.name: Own Surname
fields.desc: The portion of the surname (in most Western usage, the last name) that is derived from the person's own surname, as distinguished from any portion that is derived from the surname of the person's partner or spouse. This component is optional.

fields.name: Surname Prefix From Partner/Spouse
fields.desc: Internationalization usage for Germanic languages. This component is optional. An example of a <surname prefix> is the van in "Ludwig van Beethoven". Since the <surname prefix> doesn't sort completely alphabetically, it is reasonable to specify it as a separate sub-component of the PN and extended PN data types (XPN and XCN).

fields.name: Surname From Partner/Spouse
fields.desc: The portion of the person's surname (in most Western usage, the last name) that is derived from the surname of the person's partner or spouse, as distinguished from the part derived from the person's own surname. This component is optional.

datatypes.desc:
This data type transmits codes and the text associated with the code.

Note: retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. Refer to the CNE and CWE data types.

Example: |F-11380^CREATININE^I9^2148-5^CREATININE^LN|

fields.name: Identifier
fields.desc: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.desc: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.desc: An alternate sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.desc: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. See usage note in section introduction.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.desc: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component.

datatypes.desc: This data type identifies the segment and its constituent where an error has occurred.

fields.name: Segment Id
fields.desc: Specifies the 3-letter name for the segment.

fields.name: Segment Sequence
fields.desc: Identifies the segment occurrence within the message.

fields.name: Field Position
fields.desc: Identifies the number of the field within the segment. The first field is assigned a number of 1. Field number should not be specified when referring to the entire segment.

fields.name: Field Repetition
fields.desc: Identifies the repetition number of the field. The first repetition is counted as 1. If a Field Position is specified, but Field Repetition is not, Field Repetition should be assumed to be 1. If Field Position is not specified, Field Repetition should not be specified.

fields.name: Component Number
fields.desc: Identifies the number of the component within the field. The first component is assigned a number of 1. Component number should not be specified when referring to the entire field.

fields.name: Sub-component Number
fields.desc: Identifies the number of the sub-component within the component. The first sub-component is assigned a number of 1. Sub-component number should not be specified when referring to the entire component.

datatypes.desc: Uniquely identifies the parent results OBX segment related to the current order, together with the information in OBR-29-parent.

fields.name: Parent Observation Identifier
fields.desc: Contains the unique identifier of the parent observation as defined in the OBX-3 of the parent result. The value is the same as the OBX-3 of the parent.

fields.name: Parent Observation Sub-identifier
fields.desc: Contains the sub-ID of the parent result as defined in the OBX-4 of the parent result. The value is the same as the OBX-4 of the parent.

fields.name: Parent Observation Value Descriptor
fields.desc: Contains a descriptor of the parent observation value as specified in the OBX-5 of the parent result.

datatypes.desc: This data type indicates whether to process a message as defined in HL7 Application (level 7) Processing rules.

fields.name: Processing Id
fields.desc: A value that defines whether the message is part of a production, training, or debugging system. Refer to HL7 Table 0103 - Processing ID for valid values.

fields.name: Processing Mode
fields.desc: A value that defines whether the message is part of an archival process or an initial load. Refer to HL7 Table 0207 - Processing mode for valid values.

datatypes.desc:
The code and associated date defining a significant event relating to a bill that may affect payer processing.

Example: |23&Benefits Exhausted&NUBC^19920108|

fields.name: Occurrence Code
fields.desc: The NUBC code for the event or occurrence relating to a bill that may affect payer processing.

fields.name: Occurrence Date
fields.desc: The date the event, relating to a bill that may affect payer processing, occurred.

datatypes.desc:
This data type specifies an amount of money and the denomination in which it is expressed.

Example: |99.50^USD|

fields.name: Quantity
fields.desc: The first component is a quantity.

fields.name: Denomination
fields.desc: The second component is the denomination in which the quantity is expressed. The values for the denomination component are those specified in ISO-4217. If the denomination is not specified, MSH-17-country code is used to determine the default.

datatypes.desc: This data type specifies the number and name of the recording channel where waveform data is transmitted.

fields.name: Channel Number
fields.desc: This component specifies the number of the recording channel.

fields.name: Channel Name
fields.desc: This component specifies the name of the recording channel.

datatypes.desc: This data type specifies the policy type and amount covered by the insurance.

fields.name: Policy Type
fields.desc: Specifies the policy type.

fields.name: Amount Class
fields.desc: Specifies the amount quantity class.

fields.name: Money Or Percentage Quantity
fields.desc:
Specifies the currency or percentage quantity.

Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. Refer to PTA.4 instead.

fields.name: Money Or Percentage
fields.desc: specifies an amount that may be either currency or a percentage.

datatypes.desc: This data type contains the hours when a patient location is open for visiting. Refer to HL7 Table 0267 - Days of the week for valid values for the first two components.

fields.name: Start Day Range
fields.desc: Starting day of visiting hours range. See HL7 Table 0267 - Days of the week for valid values.

fields.name: End Day Range
fields.desc: Ending day of visiting hours range. Starting day of visiting hours range. See HL7 Table 0267 - Days of the week for valid values

fields.name: Start Hour Range
fields.desc: Starting hour on starting day of visiting hours range. See first component, 2.A.80.1, "Start Day Range (ID)".

fields.name: End Hour Range
fields.desc: Ending hour on ending day of visiting hours range See second component, 2.A.80.2, "End Day Range (ID)".

datatypes.desc: This data type specifies whether insurance certification is required for particular patient types, and the time window for obtaining the certification.

fields.name: Certification Patient Type
fields.desc: Specifies the category or type of patient for which this certification is requested. Refer to User-defined Table 0150 - Certification patient type for suggested values.

fields.name: Certification Required
fields.desc: Specifies whether or not a certification is required. Refer to HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Date/Time Certification Required
fields.desc: The date/time by which the certification must be obtained.

datatypes.desc:
Specifies a point in time using a 24-hour clock notation.

Format: YYYY[MM[DD[HH[MM[SS[.S[S[S[S]]]]]]]]][+/-ZZZZ].
This data type specifies the institutional privileges with associated detail granted to a provider.

fields.name: Privilege
fields.desc: Specifies the institutional privilege itself. Refer to user-defined table 0525 - Privilege for suggested values.

fields.name: Privilege Class
fields.desc: Specifies the class category of institutional privilege. Refer to User-Defined Table 0526 - Privilege Class for suggested values.

fields.name: Expiration Date
fields.desc: Specifies the date the institutional privilege is/was no longer valid.

fields.name: Activation Date
fields.desc: Specifies the date the institutional privilege became/becomes valid.

fields.name: Facility
fields.desc: Specifies the facility in which the institutional privilege is/was valid.

datatypes.desc: The value of such a field follows the formatting rules for an ST field except that it is drawn from a table of legal values. There shall be an HL7 table number associated with ID data types. An example of an ID field is OBR-25-result status. This data type should be used only for HL7 tables (see Section 2.5.3.6 -Table). The reverse is not true, since in some circumstances it is more appropriate to use the CNE or CWE data type for HL7 tables.

This data type is used to represent a series (array) of numeric values. A field of this type may contain a one-dimensional array (vector or row) of numbers. Also, by allowing the field to repeat, a two-dimensional array (table) of numbers may be transmitted using this format, with each row of the table represented as one repetition of the field. Arrays that have one or more values not present may be transmitted using this data type. "Not present" values are represented as two adjacent component delimiters. If the absent values occur at the end of a row, the trailing component delimiters may be omitted. If an entire row of a table has no values, no component delimiters are necessary (in this case, there will be two adjacent repetition delimiters).

Example 1: vector of 8 numbers |125^34^-22^-234^569^442^-212^6|  
Example 2: 3 x 3 array of numbers  |1.2^-3.5^5.2~2.0^3.1^-6.2~3.5^7.8^-1.3|
Specifies a person using both an identifier and the persons name

fields.name: Id Number
fields.desc: Coded ID according to a user-defined table. If the first component is present, either component 8 or 9, or both 10 and 11, must be valued.

fields.name: Family Name
fields.desc: This component contains the person's family name in a string format.

fields.name: Given Name
fields.desc: Used to specify a first name.

fields.name: Second And Further Given Names Or Initials Thereof
Suffix
fields.desc: Used to specify a name suffix (e.g., Jr. or III).

fields.name: Prefix
fields.desc: Used to specify a name prefix (e.g., Dr.).

fields.name: Degree
fields.desc: Used to specify an educational degree (e.g., MD). Refer to User-defined Table 0360 - Degree for suggested values.

fields.name: Source Table
fields.desc: Refer to User-defined Table 0297 - CN ID source for suggested values. Used to delineate the first component. If component 1 is valued, either component 8, or 9, or both 10 and 11, must be valued.

fields.name: Assigning Authority - Namespace Id
fields.desc:
Assigning Authority is normally expressed as an HD data type, but has been flattened to 3 components here (CNS.9, CNS.10 and CNS.11) in this data type so that it may be fully expressed. Also note that if additional components are added to the HD data type in the future, adjustment will need to be made accordingly to this data type. 

If component 1 is valued, either component 8, or 9, or both 10 and 11, must be valued.

fields.name: Assigning Authority- Universal Id
fields.desc: If CNN.11 is valued, this component must be valued. If component 1 is valued, either component 8, or 9, or both 10 and 11, must be valued.

fields.name: Assigning Authority - Universal Id Type
fields.desc:
If this component is a known UID refer to HL7 Table 0301 - Universal ID type for valid values.

If CNN.10 is valued, this component must be valued. If component 1 is valued, either component 8, or 9, or both 10 and 11, must be valued.

datatypes.desc: Specifies an identifier assigned to an entity by either the placer or the filler system. If both components are populated the identifiers must refer to the same entity.

fields.name: Placer Assigned Identifier
fields.desc: Specifies an identifier assigned to an entity by the placer system.

fields.name: Filler Assigned Identifier
fields.desc: Specifies an identifier assigned to an entity by the filler system.

datatypes.desc:
This data type contains the lower bound value and upper bound values that constitute a range. Either or both components may be populated.

Example 1  |+^+++| 
Example 2: Colors of the rainbow |violet^red|

fields.name: First Data Code Value
fields.desc: Specifies the lower bound value.

fields.name: Last Data Code Value
fields.desc: Specifies the upper bound value.

fields.name: Family Name
fields.desc: This component allows full specification of the surname of a person. Where appropriate, it differentiates the person's own surname from that of the person's partner or spouse, in cases where the person's name may contain elements from either name. It also permits messages to distinguish the surname prefix (such as "van" or "de") from the surname root. See section 2.A.30, "FN - family name".

fields.name: Given Name
fields.desc: First name.

fields.name: Second And Further Given Names Or Initials Thereof
fields.desc: Multiple middle names may be included by separating them with spaces.

fields.name: Suffix (e.g., Jr Or Iii)
fields.desc: Used to specify a name suffix (e.g., Jr. or III).

fields.name: Prefix (e.g., Dr)
fields.desc: Used to specify a name prefix (e.g., Dr.).

fields.name: Degree (e.g., Md)
fields.desc: Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. See Professional Suffix component.

fields.name: Name Type Code
fields.desc: A code that represents the type of name. Refer to HL7 Table 0200 - Name type for valid values.

fields.name: Name Representation Code
fields.desc: Different <name/address types> and representations of the same <name/address> should be described by repeating of this field, with different values of the <name/address type> and/or <name/address representation> component.

fields.name: Name Context
fields.desc: This component is used to designate the context in which a name is used. The main use case is in Australian healthcare for indigenous patients who prefer to use different names when attending different healthcare institutions. Another use case occurs in the US where health practitioners can be licensed under slightly different names and the reporting of the correct name is vital for administrative purposes. Refer to User-defined Table 0448 - Name context for suggested values.

fields.name: Name Validity Range
fields.desc:
This component cannot be fully expressed. Identified as v 2.4 erratum. Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. Refer to Effective Date and Expiration Date components.

This component contains the start and end date/times, which define the period during which this name was valid. See section 2.A.20, "DR - date/time range" for description of subcomponents.

fields.name: Name Assembly Order
fields.desc: A code that represents the preferred display order of the components of this person name. Refer to HL7 0444 - Name assembly order for valid values.

fields.name: Effective Date
fields.desc: The first date, if known, on which the person name is valid and active.

fields.name: Expiration Date
fields.desc: The last date, if known, on which the person name is valid and active.

fields.name: Professional Suffix
fields.desc: Used to specify an abbreviation, or a string of abbreviations denoting qualifications that support the persons profession, (e.g., licenses, certificates, degrees, affiliations with professional societies, etc.). The Professional Suffix normally follows the Family Name when the Person Name is used for display purposes. Please note that this component is an unformatted string and is used for display purposes only. Detailed information regarding the contents of Professional Suffix is obtained using appropriate segments in Chapter 15, Personnel Management.

datatypes.desc: This data type is used to communicate parameters and preferences to the filler application regarding the selection of an appropriate time slot, resource, location, or filler override criterion for an appointment.

fields.name: Parameter Class
fields.desc: The first component of this field is a code identifying the parameter or preference being passed to the filler application. Refer to User-defined Table 0294 - Time selection criteria parameter class codes - Time selection criteria parameter class codes for suggested values.

fields.name: Parameter Value
fields.desc: The second component is the actual data value for that parameter.

fields.name: Telephone Number
fields.desc:
This component has been retained for backward compatibility only as of version 2.3. 

Specifies the telephone number in a predetermined format that includes an optional extension, beeper number and comment.

Format: [NNN] [(999)]999-9999 [X99999] [B99999] [C any text]

fields.name: Telecommunication Use Code
fields.desc: A code that represents a specific use of a telecommunicationnumber. Refer to HL7 Table 0201 - Telecommunication use code for valid values.

fields.name: Telecommunication Equipment Type
fields.desc: A code that represents the type of telecommunicationequipment. Refer to HL7 Table 0202 - Telecommunication equipment type for valid values.

fields.name: Extension
fields.desc: Contains comments with respect to the telephone number.

fields.name: Any Text
fields.desc: The characters established within a companys internal telephone system network used as a prefix to the Extension component for internal dialing. Note that the use of Extension Prefix requires that the Extension component be valued and that digits, as well as special characters (e.g., *, #) may be used.

fields.name: Extension Prefix
fields.desc: The characters established within a companys internal telephone system used in place of the (external) telephone number to facilitate calling because its length is shorter than that of the telephone number. Note that digits, as well as special characters (e.g., *, #) may be used.

fields.name: Speed Dial Code
fields.desc: An expression of the telephone number as an unparsible string.

fields.name: Unformatted Telephone Number
fields.desc:
An expression of the telephone number as an unparsible string

Example: |^^^^^^^^^^^1-800-Dentist|

datatypes.desc:
Example 1: Codified job (where 1 represents the code for Administrator and F represents full time) |1^F^Administrator| 
Example 2: Uncodified job (where job codes are not codified and PT represents part time) |^PT^Analyst|.

fields.name: Job Code
fields.desc: This component contains the persons job code. User-defined Table 0327 - Job code is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component.

fields.name: Job Class
fields.desc: This component contains the persons employee classification. Refer to User-defined Table 0328 - Employee classification for suggested values.

fields.name: Job Description Text
fields.desc: This component contains the text of the job description. This will accommodate systems where job descriptions are not codified.

datatypes.desc: The General Timing Specification data type is used to communicate complex inter-related information Timing information. The value of such a field follows the formatting rules for a ST field. The string data will be structured according to the rules set forth in the "Version 3 Data Types Part II Unabridged Specification" for the General Timing Specification (GTS) data type.

This specifies the format of a column in terms of a segment field name, a data type, and a maximum length.

Example: This defines a column containing the value of the "last name" component of PID-5, expressed as a ST data type with a maximum width of 20. |@PID.5.1^ST^20|

fields.name: Segment Field Name
fields.desc: The HL7 segment field name, which identifies the field occupying the column. Refer to Section 2.A.59.1, "Segment Field Name (ST)," for segment field name definition conventions.

fields.name: Hl7 Data Type
fields.desc: The two or three character HL7 data type. Refer to HL7 Table 0440 - Data Types in section 2.16 for valid values.

fields.name: Maximum Column Width
fields.desc: The maximum width of the column, as dictated by the responding system. This may vary from the HL7-defined maximum field length.

datatypes.desc: This data type is the equivalent of an XCN data type joined with a TS data type. However, the XCN data type has been flattened to allow legal expression of its embedded complex data types HD, TS, CE and CWE.

fields.name: Id Number
fields.desc: Coded ID according to a user-defined table, defined by the 8th component. If the first component is present, either the source table or the assigning authority must be valued.

fields.name: Family Name
fields.desc: This component allows full specification of the surname of a person. Where appropriate, it differentiates the person's own surname from that of the person's partner or spouse, in cases where the person's name may contain elements from either name. It also permits messages to distinguish the surname prefix (such as "van" or "de") from the surname root. See section 2.A.30.

fields.name: Given Name
fields.desc: First name.

fields.name: Second And Further Given Names Or Initials Thereof
fields.desc: Multiple middle names may be included by separating them with spaces.

fields.name: Suffix (e.g., Jr Or Iii)
fields.desc: Used to specify a name suffix (e.g., Jr. or III).

fields.name: Prefix (e.g., Dr)
fields.desc: Used to specify a name prefix (e.g., Dr.).

fields.name: Degree (e.g., Md)
fields.desc: Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. See Professional Suffix component.

fields.name: Source Table
fields.desc: CN ID source is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this component. Used to delineate the first component.

fields.name: Assigning Authority
fields.desc: The assigning authority is a unique identifier of the system (or organization or agency of department) that creates the data. It is a HD data type. User-defined Table 0363 - Assigning authority is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for the first sub-component of the HD component, <namespace ID>.

fields.name: Name Type Code
fields.desc: A code that represents the type of name. Refer to HL7 Table 0200 - Name type for valid values (see Section 2.A.88,  XPN - extended person name ).

fields.name: Identifier Check Digit
fields.desc: The check digit in this data type is not an add-on produced by the message processor. It is the check digit that is part of the identifying number used in the sending application. If the sending application does not include a self-generated check digit in the identifying number, this component should be valued null.

fields.name: Check Digit Scheme
fields.desc: Contains the code identifying the check digit scheme employed.

fields.name: Identifier Type Code
fields.desc: A code corresponding to the type of identifier. In some cases, this code may be used as a qualifier to the "Assigning authority" component. Refer to HL7 Table 0203 - Identifier type for suggested values.

fields.name: Assigning Facility
fields.desc: The place or location identifier where the identifier was first assigned to the patient. This component is not an inherent part of the identifier but rather part of the history of the identifier: as part of this data type, its existence is a convenience for certain intercommunicating systems.

fields.name: Date/Time Action Performed
fields.desc: This component describes when the activity was performed.

fields.name: Name Context
fields.desc: This component is used to designate the context in which a name is used. The main use case is in Australian healthcare: indigenous patients who prefer to use different names when attending different healthcare institutions. Another use case occurs in the US where health practitioners can be licensed under slightly different names and the reporting of the correct name is vital for administrative purposes. Refer to chapter 3, section 3.4.2.6 for more detailed information on how to use this table. Refer to User-defined table 0448 - Name context for suggested values.

fields.name: Name Validity Range
fields.desc:
This component contains the start and end date/times, which define the period during which this name was valid. See section 2.A.20, " DR - date/time range " for description of subcomponents.

Retained for backward compatibility only as of v 2.5. Refer to PPN.20 Effective Date and PPN.21Expiration Date. This component cannot be fully expressed and was identified as v 2.4 erratum

fields.name: Name Assembly Order
fields.desc: A code that represents the preferred display order of the components of this person name. Refer to HL7 Table 0444 - Name assembly order for valid values.

fields.name: Effective Date
fields.desc: The first date, if known, on which the address is valid and active.

fields.name: Expiration Date
fields.desc: The last date, if known, on which the address is valid and active.

fields.name: Professional Suffix
fields.desc: Used to specify an abbreviation, or a string of abbreviations, denoting qualifications that support the persons profession, (e.g., licenses, certificates, degrees, affiliations with professional societies, etc.). The Professional Suffix normally follows the Family Name when the Person Name is used for display purposes. Please note that this component is an unformatted string and is used for display purposes only. Detailed information regarding the contents of Professional Suffix is obtained using appropriate segments in Chapter 15, Personnel Management.

fields.name: Assigning Jurisdiction
fields.desc: The geo-political body that assigned the identifier in component 1.

fields.name: Assigning Agency Or Department
fields.desc: The agency or department that assigned the identifier in component 1.

datatypes.desc:
This data type specifies an amount that may be either currency or a percentage. It is a variation on the MO data type that is limited to currency.

Example: USD is the ISO 4217 code for the U.S. American dollar. |AT^99.50^USD|

fields.name: Money Or Percentage Indicator
fields.desc: Specifies whether the amount is currency or a percentage.

fields.name: Money Or Percentage Quantity
fields.desc: Specifies the currency or percentage quantity.

fields.name: Currency Denomination
fields.desc: the denomination in which the quantity is expressed where the amount is currency. The values for the denomination component are those specified in ISO-4217. If the denomination is not specified, the context of the message or MSH-17-country code is used to determine the default.

datatypes.desc: This data type specifies an entity's street address and associated detail.

fields.name: Street Or Mailing Address
fields.desc: This component specifies the street or mailing address of a person or institution. When referencing an institution, this first component is used to specify the institution name. When used in connection with a person, this component specifies the first line of the address.

datatypes.desc: This data type specifies a practitioners license number, or other ID number such as UPIN, Medicare and Medicaid number, and associated detail.

fields.name: Id Number
fields.desc: Specifies the license number or other ID number such as UPIN, Medicare and Medicaid number.

fields.name: Type Of Id Number
fields.desc: Specifies the type of number.

fields.name: State/Other Qualifying Information
fields.desc: Specifies the state or province in which the license or ID is valid, if relevant, or other qualifying information. It is recommended that state qualifications use the abbreviations from the postal service of the country.

fields.name: Expiration Date
fields.desc: Specifies the date when the license or ID is no longer valid.

datatypes.desc: This data type identifies the source of the waveform connected to a channel.

fields.name: Source One Name
fields.desc: This component identifies the first input for the waveform source.

fields.name: Source Two Name
fields.desc: This component identifies the second input for the waveform source if a differential input is used.

datatypes.desc:
A code and the related dates that identify an event that relates to the payment of the claim. For example, Prior Stay Dates which is the from/through dates given by the patient of any hospital stay that ended within 60 days of this hospital or SNF admission.

 Example: |71&Prior Stay Date&NUBC^20030106^20030107|

fields.name: Occurrence Span Code
fields.desc: The date an event started that relates to the payment of a claim.

fields.name: Occurrence Span Start Date
fields.desc: The date an event ended that relates to the payment of a claim.

datatypes.desc: Specifies a coded element and its associated detail. The CNE data type is used when a required or mandatory coded field is needed. The specified HL7 or externally defined table must be used and may not be extended with local values. Text may not replace the code. A CNE field must have an HL7 defined or external table associated with it. It must be specified in the standard.

fields.name: Identifier
fields.desc: Sequence of characters (the code) that uniquely identifies the item being referenced by the CNE.2. Different coding schemes will have different elements here.

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: The descriptive or textual name of the identifier, e.g., myocardial infarction or X-ray impression. Its data type is string (ST). This is the corresponding text assigned by the coding system to the identifier.

fields.name: Name Of Coding System
fields.desc: Each coding system is assigned a unique identifier. This component will serve to identify the coding scheme being used in the identifier component. The combination of the identifier and name of coding system components will be a unique code for a data item. Each system has a unique identifier.

fields.name: Alternate Identifier
fields.desc: Analogous to Identifier in component 1.

fields.name: Alternate Text
fields.desc: The descriptive or textual name of the alternate identifier. Analogous to "Text" in component 2. See usage notes in section introduction for further description.

fields.name: Name Of Alternate Coding System
fields.desc: Identifies the coding scheme being used in the alternate identifier component. Analogous to Name of Coding System in component 3. Refer to HL7 Table 0396 in section 2.17.5 for valid values.

fields.name: Coding System Version Id
fields.desc:
the version ID for the coding system identified by component 3. It belongs conceptually to components 1-3 and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

Usage Note: If the coding system is any system other than an "HL7 coding system," version ID must be valued with an actual version ID. If the coding system is "HL7 coding system," version ID may have an actual value or it may be absent. If version ID is absent, it will be interpreted to have the same value as the HL7 version number in the message header. Text description of code is optional but its use should be encouraged since it makes messages easier to review for accuracy, especially during interface testing and debugging.

fields.name: Alternate Coding System Version Id
fields.desc: the version ID for the coding system identified by component -6. It belongs conceptually to the group of Alternate components (see note 2.A.6.6) and appears here only for reasons of backward compatibility.

fields.name: Original Text
fields.desc: The original text that was available to an automated process or a human before a specific code was assigned.

datatypes.desc: This data type defines the channel sensitivity (gain) and the units in which it is measured in a waveform result.

fields.name: Channel Sensitivity
fields.desc: This component transmits the nominal value that corresponds to one unit in the waveform data, that is, the effective resolution of the least significant bit of the ADC, and the polarity of the channel.

fields.name: Unit Of Measure Identifier
fields.desc: The unit designation for the channel sensitivity. This field is required if the unit of measure description is not present.

fields.name: Unit Of Measure Description
fields.desc: The full text name of the unit of measure identifier. This field is required if the unit of measure identifier is not present.

fields.name: Unit Of Measure Coding System
fields.desc: Specifies the designated system of units. Refer to HL7 table 0396 - Coding System in section 2.17.5 for suggested values. This field is required if the unit of measure identifier is present.

fields.name: Alternate Unit Of Measure Identifier
fields.desc: An alternate units designation for the channel sensitivity.

fields.name: Alternate Unit Of Measure Description
fields.desc: The full text name of the alternate unit of measure identifier

fields.name: Alternate Unit Of Measure Coding System
fields.desc: Specifies the coding system for the alternate unit of measure. Refer to HL7 table 0396 - Coding System in section 2.17.5 for suggested values.

datatypes.desc:
A non-negative integer in the form of a NM field. The uses of this data type are defined in the chapters defining the segments and messages in which it appears.

Maximum Length: 4. This allows for a number between 0 and 9999 to be specified
Transmits monetary information and the associated charge code for services performed.

fields.name: Monetary Amount
fields.desc: The code identifying the charge to the ordering entity for the services performed.
